solution_line_template: The total number of pages in the series is {total_books} books * {pages_per_book} pages/book = <<{total_books}*{pages_per_book}={total_pages}>>{total_pages} pages.
Sabrina read {books_read_first_month} books *{pages_per_book} pages/book = <<{books_read_first_month}*{pages_per_book}={pages_read_first_month}>>{pages_read_first_month} pages in the first month.

She still has {total_books} books - {books_read_first_month} books = <<{total_books}-{books_read_first_month}={books_remaining_after_first_month}>>{books_remaining_after_first_month} books after reading four books.

In the second month, she read {second_month_fraction}*{books_remaining_after_first_month} books = <<{second_month_fraction}*{books_remaining_after_first_month}={books_read_second_month}>>{books_read_second_month} books.

The total number of pages she read is {books_read_second_month} books * {pages_per_book} pages/book = <<{books_read_second_month}*{pages_per_book}={pages_read_second_month}>>{pages_read_second_month} in the second month.

In total, Sabrina {pages_read_second_month} pages + {pages_read_first_month} pages = <<{pages_read_second_month}+{pages_read_first_month}={pages_read_two_months}>>{pages_read_two_months} pages in two months.
Sabrina has to read {total_pages} pages - {pages_read_two_months} pages = <<{total_pages}-{pages_read_two_months}={pages_left_to_read}>>{pages_left_to_read} more pages to complete the total series.
